website_summaries.verdict: This radio delivers crisp, clear sound to help you track weather alerts and other emergency updates.
pros: Includes a battery that ensures the radio provides nearly 9 times the playback time of comparable products
Integrated LED flashlight is easy to use
Boasts a USB port that enables you to recharge your smartphone at your convenience
Comes with a built-in solar panel that provides supplemental power
Ergonomic hand crank requires minimal effort to generate power
cons: May be difficult to hold the radio and use the hand crank at the same time

customer_reviews.title: I wanted the radio in the photo, not the one I received!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a second Eton FX3 so I ordered what I thought was another of the one I already own. Photos show Eton FX3 but I got Eton FX3+... FX3 allows both lithium and AAA battery back-ups, FX3+ only allows lithium! That is a very large difference between the two products, I need something more reliable that can run on standard batteries if its charge runs out! Please spare other people the trouble I experienced and update your photos because some people may be ordering this product at the last minute and won' have the convenience of time to return it!
customer_reviews.author: JillHdz

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't trust it.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Reduced from 2 stars to 1. Put the radio up fully charged. After 2 months I pulled it out... DEAD!! WTF! I'd expect a bit of loss during a 2 month storage, but total depletion??? POS... Finally got around to buying an "emergency" radio. I have little faith that this was the right choice. Each time I moved the radio, the battery compartment door would come off and the battery would fall out. With those little wires connecting the rechargeable battery getting all twisted up and kinked when I put the battery back in, I have no confidence in its having a long lifespan. Finally put a small twig to apply pressure to keep it closed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A disaster product .. disaster
customer_reviews.text: Review for: American Red Cross Emergency NOAA Weather Radio The crank spinning is just not efficient at all. One could get carpal tunnel long before electricity. The solar panel appears to barely work, leaving it on a window sill on sunny days for days didn't help much, etc. This product looks at a glance like a less expensive but operable version of the real thing but appears to be more of a miniature playtending to be the real thing. The Red Cross should probably test this product and require qualitative upgrades before renewing name sponsorship to the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Isenberg

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: My uncle recieved it and it didnt work sending it back. Not sure whats wrong he's had many before but he tried to crank it up and nothing. Glad he tested it before he needed it. Hopefully i can send him the labels and talk him through how to send it back. He is 87 crazy were 2000 miles away from each other. And thats the only way to get it returned. Lesson learned ill buy one make sure it works then send it to him next time this is crazy that they cant help him out. He has no computer he has no tv hes 87 not 40 wow
customer_reviews.author: vikki Hatfield szatkowski

customer_reviews.title: A great upgrades to a reliable product!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously used the FRX2 as a radio and flashlight when camping with my family. After I saw the new upgrade I figured I would buy another one to keep out in the shop as well. The best part of this upgrade, to me, is the increased charging capability offered by the 1000mAh internal lithium ion battery. It seems like my iPhone sucks down the battery faster and faster and this allows me to give it a little boost while I am still walking around doing other things. The digital tuner is also nice as it easily seeks out the next station either up or down automatically with a simple press and a turn.
customer_reviews.author: AudioLabRat

customer_reviews.title: Expensive for what you get
customer_reviews.text: Works ok but unit is not rugged like the shell design would have you believe. You probably can get a better deal for less than $45. Shell made of rather thin plastic. Compartment for lithium battery not quite wide enough to contain battery - as a result the cover bulges a little when you put it on. Also, it doesn’t come with an AC charger.
customer_reviews.author: noogie

customer_reviews.title: good emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Scorpion 2 and this radio. Ended up giving the Scorpion 2 to my kids who have younger eyes. This FR3 Radio is easier to use and to see than the more compact Scorpion 2. Solar panel and battery are larger for better battery life and phone charging. It is still a small radio and will only partially charge most cell phones. The solar will take all day to charge (maybe not to 100%) and the crank will take hours. If you really want to charge phones you'll want 2-3 square feet of solar panel.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R.

customer_reviews.title: Just in case
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for an emergency kit. It’s easy to use and easy to store. This product can be hand cranked or sit it in the sun to charge through its built in solar panel (it’s quicker for hand cranking because it takes 10 hours of direct sunlight to fully charge the battery). The radio works well, it has am/fm and emergency broadcasting. It will also charge different devices. Overall I’m satisfied with the quality of this product and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Won’t recharge.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we’ve been getting some bad storms and losing power this summer. It worked great for a week or so, and then it just stopped charging. I’ve tried the crank and solar charging which were how I’d been charging it for a week or so, and then today is just totally died and won’t charge, even when I plug it in to charge it. In the sun and when cranking it, as well as when it’s plugged in, it doesn’t even show the icon saying it’s charging. Idk what happened to it, it never got wet, was never dropped, it just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Rose 🌹

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, and won’t work in emergency
customer_reviews.text: There is so much lacking in this “emergency radio” If all you wanted to do is play the radio it’s fine.. but only if it’s plugged in constantly. Even while turned off it drains the battery, and there’s no place to add batteries if needed!! So, if there ever was an emergency, the thing wouldn’t be charged and thus utterly useless, because the hand crank AND the solar panel are both non functioning. Worst overpriced purchase I’ve made in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: AmzH

customer_reviews.title: Wait for a sale!
customer_reviews.text: I have several different models of the Eton American Red Cross Red radio and the best feature is the tuner, much better than earlier ones. The big difference between the FRX3 and the FRX3+ is the FRX3 will also take AA batteries while the FRX3+ will not. The FRX3+ seldom goes on sale while the FRX3+ can be had for under $40.00 if you look. Also an AC charger is a good idea and that can be had for under $10.00. Watch the polarity on the charger as it changes with the model so you can't just use any charger that will fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mister C

customer_reviews.title: Just be careful...
customer_reviews.text: I acquire this unit exactly one year ago. I have the rechargeable battery model. It worked fine at the beginning. I left the unit near a window so it will charge using the solar panels. It is only use for emergencies and I had one today. The rechargeable battery does not work. I need to connect it to an external battery in order to use the radio. I do not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Norber.To

customer_reviews.title: Handy to have,  but does not accept regular alkaline batteries
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these weeks ago, to use as Christmas gifts. Just getting around to wrapping them and noticed they do not accept regular batteries. I was sure I chose this model for that reason, power options that included regular batteries as well as the crank, solar panel and rechargeable batteries. And because I purchased in October, my return windows on both are closed. I am sure they will be fine as emergency radios, just disappointed. Make sure to check your order right away to ensure you got what you ordered.
customer_reviews.author: NYmom

customer_reviews.title: I can't even figure out what the s**t is going on
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. No instructions that anyone can understand. No off button, you literally have to disconnect the battery in the back to turn the thing off!! Otherwise, it'll just keep itself on and wasting what little power it has. Putting the name American Red Cross on this product is a travesty!!! Plus, the battery never seem to go on full, it's always on 2 bars - forever!!!
customer_reviews.author: basahan

customer_reviews.title: This is a winner.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he was amazed at the amount of things this little machine can do. He left it in our window (in partial sun) and it played all day. The speaker is surprisingly loud for such a small radio. It has emergency lights, plugs to charge your phone & Kindle, AM-FM-Emergency weather, crank and solar, and it is ready to go right out of the box. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Librarylady

customer_reviews.title: Reliable tool for emergency situations
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in advance of hurricane season and it arrived shortly before Hurricane Dorian made landfall. We used the radio to listen to weather and news and the sound quality was very good. The hand crank was smooth and easy to turn with quick results. The charging ports are easily reached and well placed. I am very happy with this weather radio and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Watch Lover

customer_reviews.title: Good backup for news when the power is out.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is only solar battery powered so quick charging from an electrical outlet is not an option. It took two days out in the sun to get to two bars, but the charge has been holding, though I have not used the radio unless absolutely needed. The directions are miniscule.....so small that it makes it hard to read, esp. for senior eyes. Sound quality is good.....took a couple of read throughs to feel comfortable with the unit. But for the purpose intended....which is information when the power is out....it should be okay. How long the charge will last when used is yet unknown.
customer_reviews.author: laurel johnson

customer_reviews.title: It covers AM, FM and weather channels and can work during PG&E outages
customer_reviews.text: We are in Northern California so we had the recent PG&E Public Safety Power Shutoffs that lasted up to four days. This radio covers AM, FM and Weather bands, and you can recharge it with solar, hand crank or a USB cable to your car battery. During the power shutoffs I could tune into local stations giving updates on the power shutoffs as well as wildfires.
customer_reviews.author: James C Budler

customer_reviews.title: Backup device for the apocalypse
customer_reviews.text: I got this to save my butt in case the zombies attack during the impending apocalypse....I kid of course, this is my anti-HurricaneSandy device. My objective was to have a device that was self powered, had a radio for terrestrial broadcasts and NOAA alerts in case the mobile networks are out and a cell phone charger in case the power is out. Additionally it has a acceptable flashlight. The radio is good, digital tuning etc with FM, AM and NOAA bands, the charger is slow to charge but will do in a pinch. The crank is a bit tough, but I guess that’s to crank out more amps out of such a small dynamo. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: bought one, tested it briefly, liked the design, bought 2 more. Haven't had a disaster yet so haven't had to really put them to use. Appears to be really flexible so that one unit can really meet a lot of needs. Of course, can't really use it as a flashlight while dragging a recharging phone around. But its flexibility when I tested it really sold me. And if I never need to use it in a disaster, I don't mind.
customer_reviews.author: Novafyre

customer_reviews.title: Best dam fishing/camping radio I ever used
customer_reviews.text: All the - reviews just be haters. This radio and I got the smaller version and works excellent when fishing all day in the sun for 8+ hours I still get great reception the other options are great yah it doesn't have a sub woofer but you want to catch fish or scare them away. Simple charge overnight put in boat turn on and it runs alllll day they solar panel replaces power used. Use to use a DeWalt radio cost 10× as much and way bigger and heavier and always charging the battery. Fits in my pocket. BUY THIS RADIO.
customer_reviews.author: jason bergquist

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: There are dollar store toys made better than this item. Thin cheap plastic scary wiring and includes charging cable with no place to store it. Going back.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Good unit but...
customer_reviews.text: Good unit but no water resistance, in a emergency situation bad weather is too be expected, since this radio has weather features, the fact that it could get wet or rained on and stop working is a little disturbing, i assumed it was weatherproof when i got it. Other than that great little unit, just dont get it wet.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: One minute of cranking runs the radio softly for 5 minutes. One hour of solar runs the radio for 30 minutes. 8 hours of solar charges a cell phone for 5 minutes. The battery meter shows full until the battery dies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice features and design. Broke - randomly turns on radio and light by itself.
customer_reviews.text: Love the design. love the features. Sound isn't great. Love the replaceable rechargeable battery. But the unit randomly turns the radio on or the light on by itself. It is highly annoying waking up in the middle of the night hearing people talk to discover the radio decided to turn itself on.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A.

customer_reviews.title: Valuable item to own
customer_reviews.text: This saved me during a recent power outage. I used it to get radio updates several times a day due to wildfire evacuations, and the flashlight at night briefly as I was also using a solar lantern. I didn’t use the phone charger because I used a power bank. It was fully charged out of the box, and I topped it off in the sun daily so I don’t really know how long the battery lasts. I highly recommend that everyone should have one in their emergency supplies.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Battery died after one month.
customer_reviews.text: The one I ordered I thought had generic rechargeable battery replacements, but the one I received had a custom battery pack. Battery died after a month and will no longer hold a charge.
customer_reviews.author: OUTATIME

customer_reviews.title: Handy and useful
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy item and easy to use, the best feature is the charger it doesn’t take much to increase your battery life in a cell phone or other USB device. The flashlight feature is adequate for emergency or short term use. I thought the sound quality lacked and it’s not very loud at all. I wanted to use it camping or as a safety item for home use. The size is small and portable. I would recommend the larger square one, the Bluetooth feature, light quality and sound quality are worth the small upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: P. Z Cali

customer_reviews.title: Life Line
customer_reviews.text: During this pandemic working without customers and background noise. This charger, flash light radio and weather radio has really help me through especially just listening to the local stations with crisp sounds and then not having to worry about charging until 2-3 months time. All I do is put the radio by where the sun is and it starts to charge it's self, no plugs needed for a long time. This product is also perfect for trips which I plan to do once the country begins to open up.
customer_reviews.author: Blkbroda

customer_reviews.title: Great Emergency Product- Should be in every Go bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product, especially for the price. I have an earlier version of a Eton Emergency radio and while I like that one this one is superior. This product has a solar bar to charge it, glow in the dark for easy finding when power goes out and perfect size for carrying around. I was also impressed with the quality of sound when just listening to the radio on it. Overall very satisfied with the purchase, and will likely buy more for family as our new way of life in California seems to involve long periods of time with no power.
customer_reviews.author: K8wd

customer_reviews.title: When you need it, it's there
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. My first one worked so well that when I had a friend more into a hurricane zone, it was the perfect opportunity for a very useful housewarming present. Purchased extra batteries so if the electric does go off we have weather, notices and music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple design and help if needed.
customer_reviews.text: It is nice to have a weather radio at our Florida condo as sometimes to need to know. This will sound off if you need this warning about storms. I use mine for the radio and solar panel that runs all daylight hours and runs into the night with built in battery also. The sound is not as good as Bose system, but not what designed for. The smaller size helps in carrying around. Very light weight and design is pleasing to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Miller Tyme

customer_reviews.title: Great little emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio is great! So glad we finally purchased one, it will come in handy for emergencies. Stations come in clear, the speaker is pretty good for being so tiny too, the flashlight feature is really nice too (not the brightest but it works well), it's also very light. I have yet to try other features as solar charging, wind up and charging devices with it but I'm sure those will work really well as the rest of the features have lived up to expectations. I feel this will be very helpful if we get a hurricane and I feel more prepared having bought it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rothrock

customer_reviews.title: Essential for home emergency !
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem at all with my emergency radio .simple to set up ,excellent design and reception as clear as a bell ! My only concern is reading the buttons beneath the handle --- if these could be illuminated it would be perfect ! Highly recommended ! (Since writing the above , this emergency radio does have illumination on keys !)
customer_reviews.author: mannaalso2

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life and sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Very poor rechargable battery life. Liked old model, which also had AAA battery compartment (in addition to rechargable battery). Poor sound quality. Dispaly hard to read
customer_reviews.author: WJM

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. -1 star for insufficient solar charging.
customer_reviews.text: Have tested all of the functions and it works better than any of the numerous emergency weather radios I've previously owned. It is the fastest to charge using the charging handle taking less than 30 secs. It also holds a charge very well, unlike others. A little expensive at around $50, but well worth the extra dollars IMHO. Would buy for my son. UPDATE: Still the best I've had but the solar charging is not very good. I've left it in a direct southern-exposure window and the battery has never had a full charge on it. Crank works pretty well though.
customer_reviews.author: FACE

customer_reviews.title: good reception all weather channels
customer_reviews.text: Used during hurrican Irma charged fast with sunlight , good reception all weather channels ,fm/am channels. A few cranks give an hour of power at least , clock and led white light came in handy when power was out . Highly recommend to anyone living in any natural disease prone area.
customer_reviews.author: ice

customer_reviews.title: Cheap emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how long the battery lasts, but everything seems to be in working order. It was fully charged when I got mine. Sound quality is not the greatest but i can understand everything i hear coming out of it. For first inpressions I am happy with it and what I intend to use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis V. Rueda

customer_reviews.title: Automatic elert for a weather warning
customer_reviews.text: The radio is small, sleek, and very user friendly. The reception and sound quality if good. My only complaint is the instructions say after a complete 4 hour charge, the unit will monitor for a weather elect for 3 months and then will need to recharge the battery. Well, I completed the 4 hour charge and placed the unit in the automatic weather alert mode but the battery was drained after only 3 weeks. As a result, I now have the unit plugged into the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Phone charging and weather channel function does not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mostly due to the solar phone-charging function - which does not work. I've been charging it for two weeks under direct sunlight! The AM/FM radio is decent, but the weather channels do not work. Basically, I'm screwed in an emergency situation, but I'll be able to listen to the radio until the end.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to Local Weather Especially When the Internet or Cell Services are Down
customer_reviews.text: Pros; see headline Cons: sound quality is not great but still understandable, volume all the way up is fine, but hard to hear if there is other noise nearby
customer_reviews.author: Clarice

customer_reviews.title: Look for one that uses both rechargeable and disposable batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Bought August 2019 for my hurricane prep Kit. Worked fine then. Put up. Now that I may need it with Sally off our coast, won’t charge. No disposable battery backup, so useless when needed. On here looking for a compatible battery (not that it will do me any good the next 48 hours).
customer_reviews.author: M. Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Limited charge on crank
customer_reviews.text: When you crank it up charge only lasts about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak Receiver But I Like It
customer_reviews.text: I like. My only complaint is that I am less than 56 miles from 3 NOAA weather stations, but I can only receive oneof them. I’d expect the 2 stations farther out might have a faint, staticy signal...but there’s nothing even with the antenna fully extended.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Great compact, multipurpose Radio!
customer_reviews.text: The Battery life is amazing on this radio. I bought this in preparation of a hurricane and only charged it up one time using the on board hand crank. The led flashlight is super bright. The backlight digital display makes it easy to find your AM/FM radio station and displays the time when you don`t have the radio turned on. As a bonus, it charges your smartphone with the USB plug on the side. This is a great buy for hurricane preparation, camping, or just to have if the lights go out.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy G

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane life saver
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for when the power went out after the hurricane. I didn’t have to sit in my car wasting gasoline to listen to the radio and charge my phone. It also comes with a wristlet and an Android charger.
customer_reviews.author: ames

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life, perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Kind of annoyed at first that it didn't come with a replaceable battery option like my old one, but, when fully charged, the battery life kicks ass. Took it camping with a full charge, and while we didn't have it on the whole time, there was no need to crack it for the three days we were out there. Great reception, solid sound, the solar charging does take a while to get the battery 100% full, but that works great as well. It has been left out in the rain (not recommended, and not on purpose) and it seems to be fine. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Battery loses charge quickly
customer_reviews.text: Unless you happen to charge it up just before the outage, plan on it being dead. You can always give it a crank to recharge I suppose but battery quality is still poor.
customer_reviews.author: jakers

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot of cranking
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the amount of cranking required to run this radio. I had a similar radio that didn't require as much cranking for it to work. The solar function seems to work better.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: you wanted to know
customer_reviews.text: Battery would not hold charge and it is proprietary. The one sent did not have the 3 AA adapter. Also hard to get replacement from manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Little radio that can.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a NOAA weather radio for my Hurricane kit and this is the baby that works for me. Simple instructions. Great battery charge and life. Radio service is clear and volume is good. Little radio that can.
customer_reviews.author: SuzSki66

customer_reviews.title: Charging port doesn’t charge
customer_reviews.text: The charging plug does not work, it doesn’t charge a phone let alone anything else, pretty disappointed
customer_reviews.author: B. Nestel

customer_reviews.title: Neato little radio
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is kind of cheaply made, but it seems to do what it is supposed to. I just won't drop it! Honestly, sound quality is pretty bad, but I didn't buy it to listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: Paddy

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to home emergency kit!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for the brand and size of item, when I received it I was impressed with the ease of use, multi functions, and high quality of product. It completes my emergency kit and feel ready for Mother Nature and am confident this product is going to be of great service to me!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Labbie

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Sound volume ok. I keep it plugged in in the kitchen and haven't needed it for power outage yet. Use it sometimes when washing dishes. Sound quality is ok. its serving it purpose for now.
customer_reviews.author: Gilly

customer_reviews.title: Cannot use disposable batteries!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent radio, however the description is wrong. This is the new + version and DOES NOT support using AAA batteries. They enlarged the built in battery from the previous non + version and eliminated being able to use disposable batteries. Otherwise as first stated it is overall an excellent radio.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A Greenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Product was used
customer_reviews.text: Arrived obviously used and returned, very disappointed since the storm/tornado season has begun and this is a must have. I'm going to charge it and try it out and post update...
customer_reviews.author: D.A.K

customer_reviews.title: Great unit despite other reviews
customer_reviews.text: This is for the FRX3. Battery fits fine in compartment. Cover is not thin or flimsy. Features are straigtforward and a good unit all in all. Speaker is clear. Needed an ALERT NOAA radio...this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Ok quality
customer_reviews.text: The color is a little off from the picture on the website. The quality is not great also not bad. The sound quality is ok for the way it supposed usage. The led light is very dark and barely useful.
customer_reviews.author: Quan Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency safety device
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a very good product and being able to charge other electrical devices such as cell phones were small medical equipment is a great thing as well as being able to be charged
customer_reviews.author: john moore

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing. How did I ever live without it
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. How did I ever live without it! We just lived through Irma without a radio and were 5 days without power (and as result, without mobil phone power) I will always make sure I have one at hand! It charges with just a few cranks!
customer_reviews.author: Phonograph Films LLC

customer_reviews.title: A must for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: The sound is actually pretty good along with the radio reception. I used it to charge my phone a couple of times to test it out. Works just fine. I have complete confidence it will work for me during an emergency if the power should go out.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel B Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great radio!
customer_reviews.text: This Eaton is working great. It is so comforting to listen to the weather reports when the power is out during a storm. All the other features work great and are a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Pleiades

customer_reviews.title: If you like listening to radio like the old folks such as me get it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it two years ago. Use it everyday. Still running strong.
customer_reviews.author: Legofme

customer_reviews.title: Nifty 📻 Yet Soft Antenna
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally broke the top 2 sections of the telescoping antenna. It was more fragile than I thought it to be. I like that it has radio, the crank, and the USB outlet to charge your phone or tablet. During storms our power goes out and this helps me feel more ready even though I can get to the car battery for power.
customer_reviews.author: JC Gajeski

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I’m, for real, so happy with this thing. We did a lot of outdoorsy stuff prior to babies & plan to start up again soon. Plus, we travel a lot by car. I seriously feel better just having it around. Better prepared than sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Doss

customer_reviews.title: Used during Hurricane Sally.......not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to get necessary channels in my bathroom during the hurricane. The one place we found the signal would come in, the radio fell off of because the base isn't too sturdy and it broke the antenna. Needless to say I purchased another brand right then and there, it has a triangular base and much, much better signal.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: BOB Priority Item
customer_reviews.text: Great tool and a necessity for living in Florida, or anywhere really. So crucial to be able to keep in touch without power. Solar charge or wind-up or USB.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Worked for my 2 day trip just fine, put it away in original packaging, pulled it out 2 weeks later for my 5 day trip and it will no longer charge.
customer_reviews.author: tabatha

customer_reviews.title: Battery charge time length.
customer_reviews.text: The battery does not hold a charge for three months as the book says. Only lasting one month to two months, before they drain out, and require recharging off the PC.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Burich

customer_reviews.title: Won't stand up to the elements.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Death Valley, CA. Unit stays on my back porch to charge. The unit no longer works after 1.5 years. The charging mechanism is good- plenty of sunshine here for days of use at a time. Received the one radio station in the Valley well. Tuner is stuck on a.m. only now. Needs a sturdier build- not cheap plastic from overseas. May just salvage for parts for the solar cells and dynamo.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: didn't work in the real emergency.
customer_reviews.text: didn't work at all in the emergency! no replies to numerous emails to support. Got thru 800 number support and was told to ship it back to the manufacturer with the code RA#1106-331 at my own cost. No follow up, no replacement, nothing.
customer_reviews.author: akemi

customer_reviews.title: This isn't your "everyday" radio, but may well be useful in an emergency
customer_reviews.text: I don't plan to use this radio on a regular basis, but it works great and we keep it in the basement near the water heater along with our emergency first aid kit and some other emergency supplies. The crank works just great and it allows the radio to operate whatever the power situation.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Jack

customer_reviews.title: a good emergency radio/flashlight
customer_reviews.text: This hand-crank emergency radio/flashlight seems to work well. I haven't tried the USB outlet yet, but so far it does exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.author: ejr

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Radio
customer_reviews.text: Not as rugged as hoped, battery wears out relatively quickly. Fair but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Access to Weather Updates and Recharge Station for our iPhones all in one!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for emergencies with hurricane season a yearly occurrence. We wanted a solar powered version after our last experience not finding fresh batteries for sale in our area of Florida. To avoid that panic, we now are prepared like pros.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.. we will see..
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be built fairly well, very easy to use, flashlight is pretty bright! Got for our bug out bag! We are going to practice bug out this weekend and will test the phone charging etc! That’s why I rated that a two for now. Excited to see how this works! Will update my review when we get back but so far so good! (Despite some of the bad reviews on here I was worried while waiting for this to arrive!)
customer_reviews.author: Puckett

customer_reviews.title: For my emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: Good solid construction. Multiple ways to charge the built-in battery. Also, it can charge other devices like a phone or a tablet when needed. The led flashlight is a nice little bonus feature.
customer_reviews.author: Slowsync

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for Father’s Day. He was really excited and started playing with it right away. I put it in the window to solar charge well over 2 months ago and the battery is still good (we haven’t been using it). We like it
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: its really good as a flashlight and a radio but the phone ...
customer_reviews.text: its really good as a flashlight and a radio but the phone charger isn't working , when i plug in my device the display dims and it resets itself with the cell off , if you thing you can help me work this issue out please contact me at loganerbackup@gmail.com Thank you for your produce have a nice day :)
customer_reviews.author: logan graham

customer_reviews.title: This is a great option and the hand-crank placement doesn't make me feel ...
customer_reviews.text: I've always had an emergency radio and when my previous one died, I wanted something that's a bit of an upgrade. This is a great option and the hand-crank placement doesn't make me feel like I'm trying to balance the entire unit while cranking.
customer_reviews.author: Lee-Bro

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy set up, easy use.
customer_reviews.text: Tested it out of the box just using the crank energy generator. Seems to work great. Can be charged via outlet/USB cord, manually or even solar powered. Very cool. It's for emergency so I hope I don't have top use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. I let mine charge in the sun for a few hours, and it worked until I got tired of listening to the radio. The AM/FM plus the weather band all work as advertised. It even charged my iPhone. A great item or gift for the prepper, or for when those mean summer storms, that seem to be getting stronger and stronger, come.
customer_reviews.author: D. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Not okay
customer_reviews.text: I'm throwing it out. I broke the anntena and the radio and weather band don't work at all. I called the company. The radio has no fixable parts. Had been ok in urban areas. Usually no reception in remote locations. Crank and solar take a really long time to charge. Worthless for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is compack
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried it in the mountains yet, will have to use it more to see about battery life
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Good, compact and robust but...
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product, my only complaint is that you cannot memorize the radio stations.
customer_reviews.author: DLeal

customer_reviews.title: Thku 4 this Product
customer_reviews.text: Love it, Florida needs this due to power outages we experience frequently. Thku for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Love I can charge phone
customer_reviews.text: Alarm may not keep station. Great light. Radio works great. For my area. Setx.
customer_reviews.author: nike shoe

customer_reviews.title: Radio Died Suddenly
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Eton radio that lasted for years. The new one lasted 3 months, or about 30 hours of use. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam II

customer_reviews.title: Bought As A Gift
customer_reviews.text: We bought it as a gift for my brother in law. It was perfect timing too. The power went out and we where able to use it to charge our cell phones!
customer_reviews.author: Herb Yost

customer_reviews.title: Great item to keep for emergencies. Can be used to recharge cellphones!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, all functions checked out OK. A great value. 1) The diagrams for the various buttons, features had miniscule type. 2) Only the adjust down button hours on clock worked, but OK.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Has various charging capabilities, needs better sound But meets my needs
customer_reviews.author: selrach

customer_reviews.title: Buy This Radio Today
customer_reviews.text: Great buy, super radio. In today’s world, you may need this radio—big time. We are only one EMP event away.......
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM STERLING PRICE

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend great quality and help you in a emergency
customer_reviews.author: Jj

customer_reviews.title: I have not used it yet!
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes. I purchased it for future use in the case it is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bockting

customer_reviews.title: As promised
customer_reviews.text: I live in FL, and hopefully I will not need it post-Irma.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect emergency radio for the zombie apocalypse.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best emergency radio out there. Solar and crank charging. Decent sized rechargeable battery so will keep your cell phone going. Very impressed with the radio reception.
customer_reviews.author: Michael I.

customer_reviews.title: Keep your options open.
customer_reviews.text: Like the concept but it doesn’t seem to charge with the hand charger . The price was wrong for quality.
customer_reviews.author: Csisu2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: The radio performs as expected. I haven't tried the solar charging yet; However, I'm quite sure it will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra J.

customer_reviews.title: Be Prepared
customer_reviews.text: I keep one in my car always. Now my son who is a truck driver always power for his phone, and when he's back packing.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

product_meta.title: American Red Cross Emergency NOAA Weather Radio with USB Smartphone Charger, LED Flashlight & Red Beacon
product_meta.description: Style:ARCFRX3+WXRThis is the emergency radio with a large, ergonomic hand crank that requires little effort to generate power for delivering a superior combination of sound quality, playback time, and reception. Its superior audio quality provides clear, crisp sound that allows you to hear every word of a NOAA Weather Band, unlike other models that produce distorted, static-filled audio. Its superior battery provides 8.7X longer playback time than lesser models. Unlike other radios with analog tuners, it has an easy-to-adjust digital tuner that receives radio stations. Additional superior features include an integrated LED flashlight, USB port for charging smartphones, mini-USB cable, and a built-in solar panel for supplemental power. 5 3/4" H x 7" W x 2 2/3" D. (1 1/4 lbs.)
feature_bullets: EMERGENCY RADIO: Be prepared for any emergencies & disasters with this rechargeable weather alert radio with solar panel & hand turbine power generator. No emergency kit is complete without it.
STAY ALERT: The “Alert” function automatically broadcasts any emergency weather alerts for your area. Keep it charged via solar panel, hand crank or a built-in rechargeable battery
MULTIFUNCTION DIGITAL DEVICE: This AM/FM/NOAA weather band digital radio with display & alarm clock can also charge a smartphone via USB port. Also features an LED flashlight & red flashing beacon.
KEEP CONNECTED: From weather alert radios & backup battery packs to solar-powered sound systems, we'll keep you connected & in the know at home, in the office, on the road or in the great outdoors.
ETON'S COMMITMENT TO PREPAREDNESS: We're committed to helping you be prepared for everyday fun & unexpected emergency, whether you’re out on a 10-day backpacking trip or barbecuing in the backyard.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars980 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
